#/definitions/Model/asset.description: The changeable properties for an asset, also considered its 'event' as a partial state

assetID.description: An asset's unique ID, e.g. barcode, VIN, etc.

carrier.description: The carrier in possession of this asset

appdata.description: Application managed information as an array of key:value pairs

deviceID.description: A unique identifier for the device that sent the current event

devicetimestamp.description: A timestamp recoded by the device that sent the current event

temperature.description: Temperature of an asset's contents in degrees Celsuis

properties.assetidpath: An asset's primary key, expressed as a qualified property path (see example contracts)
properties.name: An asset's class name
properties.prefix: An asset's world state prefix, used to allow iteration over all assets of a class

#/definitions/Model/assetID.description: An asset's unique ID, e.g. barcode, VIN, etc.

assetID.description: An asset's unique ID, e.g. barcode, VIN, etc.
This asset's world state asset ID

properties.assetidpath: An asset's primary key, expressed as a qualified property path (see example contracts)
properties.name: An asset's class name
properties.prefix: An asset's world state prefix, used to allow iteration over all assets of a class

compliant.description: This asset has no active alerts

eventin.description: The contract event that created this state, for example updateAsset

asset.description: The changeable properties for an asset, also considered its 'event' as a partial state

carrier.description: The carrier in possession of this asset

devicetimestamp.description: A timestamp recoded by the device that sent the current event

eventout.description: The chaincode event emitted on invoke exit, if any

asset.description: A chaincode event defining the standard platform-generated result event for a contract invoke, contains an array of contributed results

properties.description: the overall status of the invoke result, defined by err

state.description: Properties that have been received or calculated for this asset

#/definitions/Model/rule.description: A rule defines a behavior that is applied to every new asset state just before writing to world state, often raises or clears alerts

match.description: Defines how to match properties, missing property always fails match

select.description: Qualified property names and values match

qprop.description: Qualified property to compare, for example 'asset.assetID'
